snippet: On Sept. 17, 2001, President George W. Bush visited a mosque and spoke eloquently about respect for Islam — an act of leadership that should be celebrated instead of overlooked.
abstract: Samuel G Freedman On Religion column observes that September 17 is the 11th anniversary of Pres George W Bush's visit to a Washington mosque, where he spoke eloquently about respect for Islam; contends that Bush's act of leadership, which came only six days after the Sept 11th attacks, should be celebrated and not overlooked.
lead_paragraph: On Sept. 17, 2001, President George W. Bush visited a mosque and spoke eloquently about respect for Islam — an act of leadership that should be celebrated instead of overlooked.

headline.print_headline: Six Days After 9/11, Another Date Worth Honoring
headline.seo: On Religion: Six Days After 9/11, Another Anniversary Worth Honoring
headline.main: Six Days After 9/11, Another Anniversary Worth Honoring
